snippet: Bidding for licenses to produce legal cannabis resembles the jockeying by those seeking to operate casinos, as hard-pressed areas vie for a potential lifeline.
abstract: New York State Health Department will grant up to five licenses to cultivate, manufacture and dispense medical marijuana; competition among bidders is fierce, especially in economically depressed areas, where the newly legal enterprise is welcomed as potential job-maker.

byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy and Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Bidding for licenses to produce legal cannabis resembles the jockeying by those seeking to operate casinos, as hard-pressed areas vie for a potential lifeline.

headline.main: Medical Marijuana Feeds Familiar Hopes of Renewal Around New York State
headline.print_headline: Latest Economic Lifeline Is a Leafy One
